messages.subject: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATION)
messages.body:
GRAND GLOBAL LOTTO PROMO LOTTERY,
THE NETHERLANDS. ALFONSTRAAT B56,
1002 BS AMSTERDAM, THE NETHERLANDS.
TO THE MANAGER
FROM: THE DESK OF THE PROMOTIONS MANAGER,
INTERNATIONAL PROMOTIONS/PRIZE AWARD DEPARTMENT,
REF: OYL /26510460037/02
BATCH: 24/00319/IPD
ATTENTION:
RE/ AWARD NOTIFICATION; FINAL NOTICE
We are pleased to inform you of the announcement
today, 16th October, of winners of the GRAND GLOBAL
LOTTO PROMO LOTTERY,THE NETHERLANDS/ INTERNATIONAL,
PROGRAMS
held on 18th march 2003.Your E mail,is attached
to ticket number 023-0148-790-459, with serial number
5073-11 drew the lucky numbers 43-11-44-37-10-43, and
consequently won the lottery in the 3rd category. You
have therefore been approved for a lump sum pay
out of US$5.5M in cash credited to file REF
NO. OYL/25041238013/02.
This is from total prize& gt; money of US$93,500,000.00
shared among the seven teen international winners in this category. All participants
were selected through a computer ballot system drawn form 25,000 names from
Australia, New Zealand, America, Europe, North America and Asia as part of
International Promotions Program, which is conducted annually. CONGRATULATIONS! Your
fund is now deposited with a Security company
insured in your name. Due to the mix up of
some numbers and names, we ask that you keep this
award strictly from public notice until your claim
has been processed and your money remitted to your
account.

This is part of our security protocol to
avoid double claiming or unscrupulous acts by
participants of this program. We hope with a part of
your prize, you will participate in our end of year high stakes US$1.3 billion
International Lottery. To begin your claim.

Please contact our,

International claim agent; MR.LESLEE JOHN
FOREIGN SERVICE MANAGER,
infomation_lottodraw@xxx

For due processing and remittance of your prize
money to a designated account of your choice.
Remember, all prize money must be claimed not later
than 30th NOVEMBER 2003. After this date, all funds
will be returned as unclaimed.
NOTE: In order to avoid unnecessary delays and
complications, please remember to quote your
reference and batch numbers in every one of your
correspondences with your agent.
Furthermore, should there be any
change of your address, do inform your claims agent
as soon as possible.
Congratulations again from all our staff and thank
you for being part of our promotions program.

Sincerely,
Stanley Martins
THE PROMOTIONS MANAGER,GRAND GLOBAL LOTTO PROMO
LOTTERY,THE NETHERLANDS.
N.B. Any breach of confidentiality on the part of
the winners will result to disqualification.
SORRY FOR THE LATE INFORMATION THANKS
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 1
< previous     next >     index
A lump sum pay out of US$5.5M in cash

These lottery frauds are becoming quite common.
Basic format is you've won a lottery and in order to get your
money you have to pay some charges.

Smaller amounts are involved but the process is quicker.

messages.subject: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATION)
messages.body:
To: Stanley Martins Esq.

My dear Mr Martins,

I am in receipt of your email thus:

REF: OYL /26510460037/02
BATCH: 24/00319/IPD
RE/ AWARD NOTIFICATION; FINAL NOTICE

I write to claim my prize money.

I must tell you this couldn't have come at a better time for me. The Warmbucket
estate is costing an arm and a leg to maintain and I was fearful that I may have to
sell one of the Van Goghs to make ends meet.

I am confused how much I have actually won. Can you confirm please.

You obedient servant

Lord Xavier Nelson Warmbucket
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 2

messages.subject: Re: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATIONS)
messages.body:
Dear Winner,(Xavier Nelson)
Thank you very kindly for your prompt response.
We also hereby congratulate you on the prize of US$ 5.5 million you've just won.
As a regional Promotions Manager/agent for the Grand Global Promo.Lotto be informed
that your name is already sent to the head office for immediate processing of your
prize and payment arrangements.
You will be sent a questionaire after this mail to enable the speedy proccessing and
confirmation of your payment.
As soon as you receive this mail,it is very important to call Mr.Lesslee John the
Regional Promotions Manager on 00225-0706-XXXX for further clarifications.
While anticipating your prompt response once again.
CONGRATULATIONS !!!       CONGRATULATIONS.!!!!!
Leslee John/ / Promotions Manager. (Regional)

messages.subject: Re: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATIONS)
messages.body:
To: Lesslee John Esq

My dear sir,

I thank you for your email. I am looking forward to receiving my $5.5 million.
Would you be so kind as to explain the following to me:

1. What has happened to Mr Stanley Martins my initial contact?
2. Why have I not received the questionaire mentioned in your email?
3. Why am I required to ring a number in Ivory Coast when the lottery is in The
Netherlands?

I remain sir, you most obedient servant

Lord Xavier Nelson Warmbucket
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 4

messages.subject: Re: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATIONS)
messages.body:
Dear Winner,
We confirm receipt of your prompt mail.
And hereby inform you that you will be communicated in the usual way your payment
date.
Be informed that Mr. Stanley martins is the foreign service PRO and secretary.
If you are truly a participant and a winner of this lotto we suppose you will know
where you bought your ticket and which office is suppose to process your claims.
Therefore  we wouldn't want to waste precious work time in vain.
We do not just send questionaires to people like that,we would need to confirm some
data to be in accordance with the laws on promo lotteries
The work ethics of the grand global promo lotto must be followed.
In anticipation to your prompt response we once again CONGRATULATE YOU and wish you
a happy and meaningful life with your prize money.
Regards.
Leslee John / Forgn service / promtns manager
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 5

messages.subject: Re: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATIONS)
messages.body:
To: Lesslee John Esq

My dear sir,

I thank you once again for your email. I am afraid very little of it made sense to
me. Your rather extraordinary use of the Queen's English has quite taken me back.

> And hereby inform you that you will be communicated in the
> usual way your payment date.

What exactly, sir, does this mean? Do I simply sit back and wait now? Do you require
my bank account details for transfer? Please inform me of the next stage in this
transaction.

> In anticipation to your prompt response we once again
> CONGRATULATE YOU and wish you a happy and meaningful
> life with your prize money.

Oh dear, I already have a happy and meaningful life. Does this disqualify me? I do
hope not. Should I act miserable and unworthy when the prize committee come
visiting? Do advise, I beg of you sir, as I am now all in a tizzy.

I look forward to your response.
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 6
< previous     next >     index
Your rather extraordinary use of the Queen's English

messages.subject: Re: LOTTO WINNER.  (CONGRATULATIONS)
messages.body:
Dear Winner,
Thank you again for your prompt response.
The grand global promo. lotto`s payment tradition to every winner is a direct CASH
payment.
Therefore no transfer into your bank account will take place,though winner`s bank
details are asked in a winner`s questionaire which you will be sent,but this is just
to be on a safe side in cases when acclaimed winner`s are not the real winners.
Do understand that you are not in any way disqualified,since every winner must prove
their data in the questionaire.
You are therefore once again adviced to attach with Dr.Leslee John the foreign
service manager on tel / fax No: 00225-0706-xxxx for the winner`s questionaire and
other important information.
As soon as you fill and return the questionaire you will then be adviced your
payment schedule.
Awaiting your early message.
Clautild Rosaline / Customer service
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 7
< previous     next >     index
You are not in any way disqualified

messages.subject: Re: Re: LOTTO WINNER. (CONGRATULATIONS)
messages.body:
To: Clautild Rosaline

My dear Madam,

I thank you for your email. I am afraid, once again, very little of it made sense to
me. Have you any native English speakers on your staff who can converse without
making a complete abortion of the language? If so please put them on this case.

I am afraid that we have calling restrictions in place. I am able to call any
national location and any international location as long as it in Europe or America.
It seems that the number you have provided is on the African continent for some
strange reason and our call restrictions prohibit connections. I would be delighted
if you were able to provide email contact details for Dr.Leslee John so that I can
contact him that way.

When returning my email perhaps you can explain why the number is in Africa when the
Loto is in The Netherlands?

I look forward to your response.

I remain madam, you most compliant and deferential servant

Lord Xavier Nelson Warmbucket
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?
Scam 9
Email 8
< previous     next >     index
Converse without making a complete abortion of the language

I remain madam, you most compliant and deferential servant

Lord Xavier Nelson Warmbucket

Your several mails were passed to me this morning. Thanks.
In the effort to speedily proccess your lotto data and advice you your payment

30th november.
We expect your urgent return of the questionaire.
Kindest regards.

Claims Dept. GGPL

email.

The form asks questions that one can't know the answer to.
Presumably this is part of the scam. You need their help to
claim and they charge you. We'll see...

In the meantime I've filled all the fields out. Many of them wrong.

Answers are  here

messages.subject: YOUR PAYMENT IS READY (Don't Forget Leslee John)
messages.body:
Dear Winner (xavier).
Your returned questionaire was passed to me yesterday (monday) morning.
And I'm afraid you didn't present your lotto data as they appear in our file.
As identified in your file,you bought 4 tickets and only one ticket won the draw.
Your file no;ticket nos;certificate of purchase nos;and your 6 digit secret winning
nos; appear differently with us.
However the GGPL (grand global promo. lotto) is  bent to making sure that all
winners receive their payments.
In this respect,I hereby confirm your data as follows:
1.No: OF TICKETS PURCHASED ..........4
2.TICKET NOS
(a)023 /473/856/129.
(b)023/072/934/686.
(c)023/0148/790/459.
(d)023/0437/126/257.
3.WINNING TICKET No:..........023/0148/790/459.
4.6 DIGIT SECRET No:..........045013.
5.FILE No:......OYL/25041238013/025.
6.BATCH No:..........24/00319/IPD.
7.CERTIFICATE OF PURCHASE No:.......GGPL/03/004/964224011149.
Be informed that your prize money is now ready for disbursement to you in amsterdam
holland at the
LAVE GUARD SECURITY COMPANY OFFICE.(Find the contact info. and address below)
As soon as you receive this mail you are adviced to contact the security company to
confirm your payment scedule.
At the paying centre you will be asked to reconfirm your lotto data / info.
You will therefore need to go along with all your lotto data to avoid being
embarrassed
While it is strongly cautioned that in order to avoid a double claim keep as usual
all your lotto information secret and confidential.
THE SECURITY COMPANY NAME:
LAVEGARDE SECURITY AND FINANCE HOUSE.
AMSTERDAM LIASON OFFICE,

messages.subject: Re: YOU MUST HAVE CALLED A WRONG No:
messages.body:
Dear Winner,
It is an unbelievable fact that the security company's telephone and fax line cannot
be reached.A security company number is always a hot line number.
It is also impossible for the telephone line to be connected to a chinese
restaurant.
Yesterday a winner confirmed his payment schedule with the same number.
He's either on his way to or already in Amsterdam to collect his prize money.
You must have called a wrong number.
I hereby reconfirm the director's direct number as 0031-6-478-XXX-XX.
You can call them immediately to confirm your payment.
The director of the security company is a gentleman.
Keep us informed as soon as you get through.
Dr. Leslee John.
foreign service manager.
GGPL.

woman,whose payment is scheduled for this afternoon.And all her calls to this office
were uninterupted.

forward to hear from you.

messages.subject: lotto payment schedule
messages.body:
To: Mr. Philip Mormoh

My dear Mr. Mormoh,

Further to my corespondence with Dr. Leslee John, he has instructed me to ask you to
confirm my lotto payment schedule.

I would entreat you to hurry this transaction through as the gentlemen from the
Inland Revenue are insisting I pay the £2.8 million in inheritance tax that has been
outstanding for some months.

Without the prize money I will be forced to sell one of the Van Goghs or send the
old dear out on the streets again.

I remain sir, your most obedient servant and look forward to your response.

Lord Xavier Nelson Warmbucket
messages.raw:
Whats the Bloody Point?

NOVEMBER 2003, AT 2PM. YOU ARE HEREBY REQUIRED TO CONTACT US LATEST TOMORROW

My dear Mr. Mormoh,

How jolly spiffing. This will get the vultures off my back. I have booked my
flights. Will you be able to arrange a pick-up at the airport?

My flight details are:

Airline KLM
KL 1002

From: HEATHROW AIRPORT(LHR)
Depart: 0840 on 17/11/2003

To: AMSTERDAM(AMS)
Arrive: 1105 on 17/11/2003

Please have the person I am meeting identify themselves with my name on a board.
"Lord Warmbucket" is sufficient.

I remain sir, your most obedient servant and look forward to your confirmation.

Lord Xavier Nelson Warmbucket

messages.subject: Re: lotto payment schedule
messages.body:
Attention Sir Warmbucket,

I am sorry that there will not be a person at the airport to pick you up.
Though you will be picked up later in the day to my office. I recommend that
you should wait either at the reception of the Sheraton hotel at the airport
or rent a room there at the sheraton and call me from there. Meanwhile, you
can dial my number as follows 0647858372 and I will send my driver to pick
you up to my office.

I hope that you will still receive this mail in time before departing.

Yours faithfully,

Mr. Philip Momoh
